title: logo/branding help!
content:
hello!  
i just found this site by accident. i am hoping i’m at the right place.....  
i have 2 businesses here in charleston sc, one photography, one wedding hair on location.  
i am struggling with a logo and identity for my photo biz. i’m working on my “style” but want a “feeling” behind the site.  
retro and artistic fonts appeal to me, but i have no idea....  
please look at my site: [www.julietelizabeth.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080111001429/http:/www.julietelizabeth.com/ "www.julietelizabeth.com")  
any suggestions would be appreciated! (sometimes when you look at something too long you lose a sense of being objective).  
thanks!  
j

 [‹ Bottle-arsed type?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080111001429/http:/typophile.com/node/37899 "Go to previous forum topic") [document management software for windows? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080111001429/http:/typophile.com/node/37838 "Go to next forum topic")
author: juliet

comments.content:
Juliet,

What exactly are you looking for? Are you looking for someone to help you or give feedback? It’s a little unclear.

yup, i need help choosing a font! i just really want to know what style of logo i should go for based on the “feeling” behind the photos on my site....  
i am still adding photos, and will eventually have a “fashion” section gallery of artsy stuff. i just can’t decide what type of logo to use! :-)
Graphic Designers love good photography. Find a designer and swap photos of their kids for a logo for you. ;0)

Here are a few type ideas. But I agree with getting a designer to help you out.

[Clifford](http://web.archive.org/web/20080111001429/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_clifford/)

[Jenson](http://web.archive.org/web/20080111001429/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=jenson&x=0&y=0)

[Pepe](http://web.archive.org/web/20080111001429/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_pepe/)

[Sirenne](http://web.archive.org/web/20080111001429/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/mvb_fonts/mvb_sirenne_text/)
